trans-unit.source: In your applications, you load the classes either by indirectly referencing them in the code or by directly using java.lang.Class.forName.

seg-source.mrk: In your applications, you load the classes either by indirectly referencing them in the code or by directly using java.lang.Class.forName.

target.mrk: In your applications, you load the classes either by indirectly referencing them in the code or by directly using java.lang.Class.forName.

trans-unit.source: You load resources the way you normally would, using the standard java.lang.Class.getResourceAsStream, a mechanism that allows an application to access resources defined in the classpath without knowing where or how they are stored.

seg-source.mrk: You load resources the way you normally would, using the standard java.lang.Class.getResourceAsStream, a mechanism that allows an application to access resources defined in the classpath without knowing where or how they are stored.

target.mrk: You load resources the way you normally would, using the standard java.lang.Class.getResourceAsStream, a mechanism that allows an application to access resources defined in the classpath without knowing where or how they are stored.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to make any changes to the way code interacts with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and its JDBC driver. An application can safely attempt to boot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, even though it is already running, without any errors. Applications connect to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in the usual manner.
